posts.name:
Matt Williams
Matt Williams
posts.content:
Witnessing your own generation become socially irrelevant on LinkedIn is surreal.

A very rare few in my age group (45-55) are active on LinkedIn‚Ä¶technically they‚Äôre here, but their voices are muted.

-They consume content, but they don‚Äôt post.
-They comment, but only if prompted.
-They have opinions, ideas, knowledge and above all experience (aka wisdom)‚Ä¶but they choose not to share.

And with that my generation is quickly fading into obscurity as social platforms are adopted by younger generations open to sharing opinions / expertise / advice.

Creating a massive generational void to navigate for the seasoned business vets who simply don‚Äôt want to participate.

I hear from many in my age group complaining about losing market share, business and revenue because they are being out flanked by a younger generation leveraging LinkedIn and other social platforms.

And in the same breath‚Ä¶turn around and make fun of the young professionals who are eating their lunch on LI because they simply ‚Äúdon‚Äôt get it‚Äù.

Don‚Äôt get it = EGO
Don‚Äôt get it = LAZY
Don‚Äôt get it = COMPLACENT
Don‚Äôt get it = GAME OVER

If I‚Äôm talking to you or someone you know‚Ä¶please do yourself a favor and take advantage of this FREE platform.

I‚Äôll make it easy‚Ä¶here is a cheat sheet to get started in 5 weeks:

Week 1 - like 20 posts daily
Week 2- leave 20 comments daily
Week 3- repost content you enjoy
Week 4- add thoughts to your reposts
Week 5 and beyond- POST YOUR OWN CONTENT

TIP- be yourself, be kind, teach others and laugh.

If there is someone you‚Äôd like to see more of on LinkedIn drop them in comments or DM me their info.

I‚Äôll connect with them about my strategy for battling the ‚Äúcringe‚Äù‚Ä¶and how to build their reputation on LinkedIn.

Their knowledge is becoming increasingly more valuable for new entrepreneurs, business owners and yes, even the mighty influencers.

__________________
Bonus Tip- invest in a solid image and hook to draw people into your post.

comments.commentText: Good word bro. We have to always be learning! I never want to become that ‚Äúgrizzled veteran‚Äù that looks down on those things I don‚Äôt understand.
Brent Lavin, MBA yep‚Ä¶evolve or die

I can't wait to be the dopest 70 yr old on LinkedIn in a few years.

Also, you and Keith Carson are my favorite Gandalfs ever
Luke Frazier  I knew you were a vampire‚Ä¶

posts.name:
Aditya Chaturvedi
Aditya Chaturvedi
posts.content:
Thrilled to Share a Milestone! 
I am delighted to announce the completion of the Intellectual Property Specialization, a journey that deepened my understanding of the value and strategic importance of patents, copyrights, and trademarks.
Through this program, I gained insights into the transformative role intellectual property plays in innovation and business success. From developing trademark strategies to analyzing patents and addressing copyright issues, the hands-on projects equipped me with practical skills to craft integrated IP strategies tailored to organizational goals.
As intellectual property continues to shape the future of technology, pharmaceuticals, and entertainment, I am excited to leverage this knowledge to contribute effectively in the legal and business domains.
A big thank you to the instructors and peers who made this learning experience so enriching!

posts.name:
Ikpia Blessing Isioma
Ikpia Blessing Isioma
posts.content:
To every woman who has ever been told ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Not for You‚Äù

I grew up surrounded by incredible women‚Äîresilient, talented but full of untapped potential. I‚Äôve witnessed how many of them were held back by barriers they never chose: lack of access, resources and opportunities.

This is why I‚Äôm deeply honored to lead AI Women Rising, a movement designed to change this narrative.This isn‚Äôt just about tech. It‚Äôs about hope. It‚Äôs about creating a world where women, no matter where they come from, can thrive in a digital and AI-driven era.

AI Women Rising is more than just a project, it‚Äôs a lifeline for women in marginalized and underserved communities who dare to dream of a better future. It‚Äôs a space where we say:
"Your background doesn‚Äôt define you, your future does."

 Imagine learning cutting-edge Tech and AI skills, not just for yourself, but to uplift your family, your community and the world.

 Picture a world where women‚ÄîYOU‚Äîare at the forefront of innovation, making decisions, solving problems and shaping industries.

 This is your invitation to rise.
If you‚Äôve ever felt like the doors to opportunity were closed, I‚Äôm here to tell you they‚Äôre wide open now.

Applications for AI Women Rising are now open!

Click here to apply :

To the woman reading this:

 You are stronger than the obstacles you‚Äôve faced.
 You are worthy of every opportunity.
 And you are exactly who this initiative was created for.

To my LinkedIn community and family:
 If this speaks to you or someone you know, share it Ô∏è
 Let‚Äôs amplify this mission and give women the opportunity to rise, thrive and lead.

Together, we can build a future where women from all walks of life have the tools, confidence and opportunities to succeed.

posts.name:
Steven Claes
Steven Claes
posts.content:
HR isn't the problem.
(The brutal truth no one's telling you)

Bad bosses kill dreams.
Ignored ideas crush spirits.
Cutting corners hurts everyone.

Your Company's Culture starts with YOU, not HR.

Want to build an unstoppable team? Look in the mirror.

Being in HR for many years, I've seen it all.

The best leaders?

‚Ü≥ They own Their Work Culture.

The worst?

‚Ü≥ They blame HR for Everything.

Here's how to actually fix it:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Listen with your whole heart

‚Ü≥ Hear the whispers, not just the shouts
‚Ü≥ Ask what really matters (then act on it)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Celebrate the small wins

‚Ü≥ Catch people being awesome
‚Ü≥ Make victories feel like magic

3Ô∏è‚É£ Unlock hidden superpowers

‚Ü≥ Find each person's unique genius
‚Ü≥ Show them how to use it

4Ô∏è‚É£ Be real (always)

‚Ü≥ Share your ups AND downs
‚Ü≥ Let your team see the human behind the title

5Ô∏è‚É£ Own your mistakes

‚Ü≥ Say sorry when you mess up
‚Ü≥ Show it's okay to learn and grow

Yes, HR is your ally.
But the Culture (r)evolution?
That's everyone's mission.

Stop blaming HR.
Start Leading with Heart.

Agree? Disagree? A bit thought provoking 
_________________________
